questions.question_text:
An app builder installs an unmanaged package in a full copy sandbox that is an exact match for production, and now they are ready to install it in production. When the app builder attempts to install the package in production, it fails.

Why did the package fail to install?

discussion.content: package installation failed in production after successfully installing it in a full copy sandbox, which is an exact match for production. In such cases, the most common reason for the installation failure in production is Apex unit test failures. Salesforce requires that all Apex tests pass successfully before allowing the installation of a package into a production environment. D is the Answer

Selected Answer: D
Because they explicitly say "exact match for production" I feel D is the best answer.
question says "full copy sandbox that is an exact match for production" so it means all features and license is the same with prod. The only issue might be unit tests D
